        <div class="article-text-title">
         Baked Mashed Sweet Potato with Orange and Pecan
        </div>
        <div class="article-text-heading">
         <div class="article-text-byline">
          <span class="feedID_pagebyline">
           Recipe from Bob Greene's Best Life Diet
          </span>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="article-left">
        <div class="article-content " data-index="1" data-type="text">
         <div class="article-text-body Article" id="article1774">
          <div class="article-content-container">
           <div class="top-content">
            <div class="article-body">
             <div class="article-text-content">
              <div class="feedID_pagebody">
               <div class="georgia14" style="margin-bottom:10px;">
                <b>
                 Servings: Serves 4
                </b>
               </div>
               <div class="georgia24" style="font-size:26px">
                Ingredients
               </div>
               <div class="georgia18">
               </div>
               <ul style="list-style-position: inside; list-style-image: url(http://static.oprah.com/images/articles/Bullet_14pt_666e72_082510.png); padding:0; margin:3px 0px 15px 3px;">
                <li>
                 2 large sweet potatoes
                </li>
                <li>
                 2 oranges , peeled, sectioned and roughly chopped
                </li>
                <li>
                 1/2 tsp. rosemary , finely chopped
                </li>
                <li>
                 1/8 tsp. salt
                </li>
                <li>
                 1/2 cup pecans , roughly chopped
                </li>
               </ul>
               <div class="georgia18" style="margin-top:30px;">
                Directions
               </div>
               <div style="margin-top:10px; line-height:18px; margin-bottom:30px;">
                Heat oven to 400.
                <br/>
                <br/>
                Place sweet potatoes on a sheet tray and bake until tender, about 30 minutes (exact time varies depending on size).
                <br/>
                <br/>
                Remove potato skins and mash with orange, rosemary, salt and pepper to taste.
                <br/>
                <br/>
                Put mashed sweet potatoes in 1 large pan (or 4 individual ramekins) and sprinkle with pecans.
                <br/>
                <br/>
                Bake until pecans are toasted, about 5 minutes.
                <br/>
                <br/>
                <b>
                 Note:
                </b>
                Round this out with 3 ounces of cooked fish, skinless poultry or lean meat and 1 cup of steamed vegetables with a spritz of lemon juice or balsamic vinegar.
                <br/>
                <br/>
                <em>
                 Recipes from The Best Life Diet by Bob Greene,  2009. Used by permission.
                </em>
               </div>
               <div class="georgia18">
                Nutritional Information
               </div>
               <div style="margin-top:10px; margin-bottom:30px; line-height:18px;">
                Per serving: calories: 210; protein: 4 g; carbohydrates: 26 g; dietary fiber: 6 g; fat: 4 g; saturated fat: 1 g; cholesterol: 0 mg; calcium: 64 mg; sodium: 102 mg
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
